data.title: The Romance of London. A Collection of Strange Stories, Scenes and Vicissitudes associated with the History of London. NEAR FINE SET by TIMBS John - n.d. [c. 1930]
data.meta_description: BLAH:Find The Romance of London. A Collection of Strange Stories, Scenes and Vicissitudes associated with the History of London. NEAR FINE SET by TIMBS John - n.d. [c. 1930]
data.text:
Lives of Wits and Humourists, Vol. I

by John Timbs

Used

Acceptable

Hardcover

Show Details

Description:

Richard Bentley, 1862. Hardcover. Acceptable. 1862. no. 396 pages. This is an ex-Library book. Quarter bound leather with cloth covered boards. Book has been rebound by library, with expected inserts, stamps and inscriptions. Heavy tanning and foxing to pages and text block edges. Some annotations and marginalia to occasional pages. Tape marking and tanning to pastedowns and endpapers. Boards have moderate shelf wear, with rubbing and marking. Light bumping to corners and crushing to spine ends. Boards are slightly bowed and tanned.

Item Price

US$5.12

Abbeys, Castles and Ancient Halls of England and Wales : North and Wales

by John Timbs & Alexander Gunn

Used

Good

Hardcover

Show Details

Description:

Fredk. Warne, 1111. Hardcover. Good. 571 pages. No dust jacket. Red cloth with gilt lettering. Pages are lightly tanned and thumbed at the edges, with light foxing. Binding has remained firm. Boards are a little rub worn, slight shelf wear to corners, spine and edges. Corners are a little bumped. Spine ends are mildly crushed. Tanning to spine and edges. Boards are bowed. Book has a forward lean. Water marks to boards and spine.

Description:

Frederick Warne and Co, NULL. Volume 1. Book has been rebound. Small amount of foxing on several pages, but text remains readable.This book has hardback covers. Ex-library, With usual stamps and markings, In good all round condition. Please note the Image in this listing is a stock photo and may not match the covers of the actual item,700grams, ISBN:

The Romance of London

by John Timbs

Used

Good

Hardcover

Show Details

Description:

Frederick Warne & Co. Ltd, 1111. Hardcover. Good. No Edition Stated. 509 pages. No dust jacket. Blue cloth. Pages and binding are presentable with no major defects. Minor issues present such as mild cracking, inscriptions, inserts, light foxing, tanning and thumb marking. Overall a good condition item. Boards have mild shelf wear with light rubbing and corner bumping. Some light marking and tanning.

A Century of Anecdote, from 1760 to 1860

by John Timbs

Used

Acceptable

Hardcover

Show Details

Description:

Frederick Warne, 1111. Hardcover. Acceptable. No Edition Remarks. 597 pages. No dust jacket. Blue cloth. Pages are moderately tanned and foxed throughout. Thumb-marking present. Noticeable creasing to gutter. Cracking to hinges and gutters, leaving netting exposed. Boards have moderate edge-wear with bumping to corners and rubbing to surfaces. Soft crushing to spine ends. Noticeable tanning to spine and edges. Water staining to boards. Splits to spine ends.

Item Price

US$10.37

A Century of Anecdote, from 1760 to 1860

by John Timbs

Used

Acceptable

Hardcover

Show Details

Description:

Frederick Warne & Co., 1111. Hardcover. Acceptable. No edition remarks. 597 pages. No dust jacket. Green cloth with gilt lettering. Clean pages with mild tanning and moderate foxing throughout. Tightly bound with faint thumb-marking throughout. Previous owner's inscription to half title page. Notable water staining to pages throughout. Pencil inscription to front pastedown. Boards have light edgewear with corner crushing and notable marking to boards. Mild tanning to spine, which has mild crushing to ends. Hole to front board. Boards are notably warped.

Item Price

US$11.92

Anecdote Lives of the Later Wits and Humourists Vol. II

by John Timbs

Used

Acceptable

Hardcover

Show Details

Description:

Richard Bentley and Son, 1874. Hardcover. Acceptable. 1874. No Edition Remarks. 328 pages. No dust jacket. This is an ex-Library book. Red cloth with gilt lettering. Ex-library copy, with expected inserts and inscriptions. Pages are mildly tanned throughout. Text is clear. Both hinges are cracked, front board has loosened. Binding remains firm. Boards have moderate edge-wear with bumping to corners and rubbing to surfaces. Visible sunning & crushing to spine. Noticeable splitting to spine joints, spine remains attached. Minor splits causing fraying to cloth at spine ends. Slight white staining. Gilt lettering remains bright and clear.

Item Price

Description:

Lockwood & Co., 1867. Hardcover. Good. 1867. No Edition Stated. 288 pages. No dust jacket. Brown cloth with gilt lettering. B&W illustrations throughout. Minimal foxing and tanning to endpapers and page edges. Some gutter cracking. Mild wear and bumping to spine, board edges and corners, with scuffing and soiling to boards. Notable tanning to spine. Spine ends crushed.
